content.description:
Pliny on his Elderly Friend

Nupernuper, adv.: recently apud Spurinnam fui. Neminem magis 
in senectutesenectus, -us, f.: old age aemulariaemulor, -ari: to imitate velim. Post septimum et septimum et septuagensimum = “seventy-seventh”
septuagensimumseptimum et septuagensimum = “seventy-seventh” annum erat illi aurium et 
oculorum vigorvigor, -oris, m.: strength integerinteger, -gra, -grum, adj.: unimpaired, agileagilis, -e, adj.: nimble, agile corpus, solaque 

ex senectute prudentia.
content.question: In line 3, erat illi is translated

unit.text: 3: Pliny's Letters: Ghosts and Apparitions, Letters to Trajan and Calpurnia, and Teacher's Choice - Latin Prose

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
